qas.question: Who agreed with all three forms of materialism?
Who agrees that materialism is not a self-refuting idea?
Who wrote the Refutation of Materialism?

context: <b0_0><b1_0>Kant<b1_0/><b0_0/> argued against all three forms of materialism, subjective idealism (which he contrasts with his "transcendental idealism") and dualism. However, <b4_0>Kant<b4_0/> also argues that change and time require an enduring substrate, and does so in connection with his Refutation of Idealism. Postmodern/poststructuralist thinkers also express a skepticism about <b2_0>any all-encompassing metaphysical scheme<b2_0/>. Philosopher <b3_0>Mary Midgley<b3_0/>, among others, argues that materialism is a self-refuting idea, at least in its eliminative form.
